text: Impatiens letouzeyi is a species of flowering plant in the family Balsaminaceae. It is endemic to Cameroon, where it occurs in the Bakossi Mountains. It grows as an epiphyte in trees and shrubs, as well as a terrestrial herb. It is threatened by plans for the construction of a reservoir in the area.Cheek, M. 2004. Impatiens letouzeyi. In: IUCN 2013. IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2013.1.
